summary: This is an email forwarding a New York Times article about Patrick Kessler, an apparent con man who attempted to convince David Boies and Stanley Pottinger that he possessed video evidence of sexual abuse by well-known figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The email appears to be internal DOJ correspondence sharing the article.

persons.name: Patrick Kessler
persons.context: Described as attempting to convince David Boies and Stanley Pottinger that he had video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: One of the individuals Patrick Kessler attempted to convince about possessing video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein-associated figures.

persons.name: Stanley Pottinger
persons.context: One of the individuals Patrick Kessler attempted to convince about possessing video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein-associated figures.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the forwarded article discusses alleged sexual abuse by figures associated with him.

connections.description: Kessler attempted to convince Boies he had video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein-associated figures.
Kessler attempted to convince Pottinger he had video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein-associated figures.
Both were attorneys approached by Patrick Kessler regarding the alleged video evidence.

events.title: NYT Article Publication
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article about Patrick Kessler's attempts to sell alleged video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein-associated figures to David Boies and Stanley Pottinger.

keyFacts: Patrick Kessler is described as an apparent con man who claimed to possess video evidence of sexual abuse by well-known figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
Kessler attempted to convince attorneys David Boies and Stanley Pottinger of the existence of this video evidence.
The New York Times published an article on November 30, 2019, detailing Kessler's claims and attempts.
The document is an internal DOJ email forwarding the NYT article, indicating official interest in the story.
